text: UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Murky brown, minimal head but really nice lacing. Nice smoked malt, kind of rye bread aroma. Not much carbonation, smokey malt, sticky caramel. Big filling doppelbock, heavy on smoke.

Bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours a lightly misty reddish brown, small off-white head. HUGE smoked ham aroma. Taste is massive smoked meat, smooth smoked malts, quite rich but absolutely takes the smoked doppelbock to the next level. Awesome.

Botella @Cimmeria, Oviedo 26/05/17. BBD: 12 /10/18. Color ambarino espuma beige aromas ahumados con notas a madera el sabor es ahumados con un buen cuerpo sedoso, sensaciÃ³n en boca agradable, buena cerveza.

Pours brown-ish dark amber, with just the tiniest bit of a foamy string forming up. Nice candied pastrami on the nose, smoked grain, some red fruit sweetness, smoked honey, salt and pepper. Starts with some sweet malt and some alcohol, developing into rich honey-covered smoked bacon. Crunchy grains, too. Some spicy hop in the finish. Lingering sweet smokey malts, somewhat sticky, but quite pleasant. Never too sweet. AlcoholÂ’s well in check. A really solid rauchbier. Need me some more of this.

Bottle from Drinkshop. Lacking head, colour is hazy brown. Smoke centered, traditional beech smoke imo. There is relatively strong sweetness, while there is little in terms of malt character besides the smoke. Alcohol also manifests moderately, which is not so bad per se, but this particular beer would do well without it. Overall not bad though, rather enjoyable, but a hard drinking one while being relatively simple.
Sweet, smoked meat, bacon, roasted malts profile. ItÂ’s like blended bacon. Long, smoky and sweet aftertaste. Not bad at all.

Mission Dolores, Brooklyn tap: pours mahogony with a white head. Aroma is smokey and quite large and malty. Taste is smokey without being in the least bit burnt. Kind of sweet. Large but not boozy. Pretty nice.

Edel bis unter die FuÃŸsohle. Schmatzend smokey, kuchig verspielt & wahnwitzig earthhoppy. Outstanding Doppelbocker mit dem ExtraGeekKick ðŸ‘½...likÃ¶riÃ¶s gleitend und deutlich BITTER...0,33l Buddel from DeMolen in Holland ðŸ˜‰...unter 3Â€ ðŸŽ†

From a 330ml bottle on 1/5/2017. Pours a cloudy amber with no head. The nose is intense, with smoked meat, campfire ash and caramel.In the mouth, its quite a singular and very intense experience. A dessert smoked beer? Well we have one here and itÂ’s works. Things begin sweet and sticky, with lots of sweet caramel and toffee. The smoke is noticeable, but sits in the background along with a significant, lingering, almost burnt bitterness. The 9.6% is no surprise here - itÂ’s a big syrupy sipper. The palate is quite oily and there is just the barest hint of carbonation. Not for everyone, but if you into smoked beers, have a sweet tooth and sense of adventure, you may love it.
Donkerbruin bier zonder schuim. Wow ! Smaak is zoet en krachtig met iets van gerookte ham/umami en caramel. Bijzondere combinatie die erg goed uitpakt.

Deliciosa. Color entre bronce y rojizo, de cuerpo denso y viscoso y espuma blanca. Aroma muy ahumado, con caramelo y madera. El sabor predominantemente ahumado, dulce, caramelo, fruta confitada y alcohol presente y bien integrado. Ã‘aka!
Pours reddish brown, not much foam. Smoked cheese and more smokey stuff in the nose. Bacon and even more smoked cheese on the taste, pretty dense. Sweet and cheesy. Smokey as hell. Good.

(Bottle) Pours cloudy red dark brown with tiny white head. Lovely smoky aroma - bacon, cheese, leather, wood. Smooth, oily, full bodied, with gentle carbonation. Great taste - complex, rich - smokiness dominates in a good way, and itÂ’s a smooth, almost meaty smokiness - good malty sweetness through start and mid palate. Some good bitterness in finish. The alcohol is clearly present, but well balanced against the other dominant flavours. Excellent beer.

Deep Mahogany color. Massive smoked malt, tons of BBQ chips with smoked cheese. Slightly sweet, tons of BBQ with just liquid smoked meat. Omg this is good. Low carbonation. The sweet and smokey play so well together. Awesome.

33cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 25-03-2017.
BBD: 12-10-2018.
In short: nice smoked.
Pours little hazy dark copper, with little off white head, fast vanishing, little lacing. Nice smoky aromas, some apples and caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily to viscous texture. Taste is quite smoky, but well integrated with sweet, caramel and fruity flavours. Alcohol noticed, still balanced, but you notice this is a robust beer. Very enjoyable.
rood bruin met beperkte creme kraag. aroma van rook mout, banaan, toffee, mout. Smaken van redelijke gerookte mout, ham, caramel, chocolade, wat aards, lichte noten, matige body, normale co2. best ok

Geproefd tijdens Borefts 2016, van de tap in het proefglas, mijn eerste bier van deze Duitse microbrouwerij. Troebel goud oranje van kleur, met een kleine beige schuimkraag. De aromaÂ’s zijn overweldigend rokerig, maar niet scherp turf of teerachtig als bij de NÃ¤rke SvartmÃ¶lska hiervoor. Eerder zacht, als in beukenhout rook, dit doet inderdaad denken aan gerookte ham, als een SchwarzwÃ¤lder Schinken, heel bijzonder! Verder ook zoete accenten van karamel en honing, gecombineerd met kruidige accenten van peper en boskruiden. Verder honing, mosterd dille dressing, gerookte zalm, heel apart maar toch perfect in balans! De smaak is zoet en erg rokerig, licht hartige umami tonen, beukenhoutrook, bacon, de moutige zoetheid wordt geaccentueerd door tonen van karamel en honing, daarna een drogere afdronk van houtige tonen en kruiden. Het mondgevoel is dik, zacht en olieachtig, met een medium carbonatie, en een zachte alcoholwarmte in de finish. Een zeer mooie gerookte Doppelbock, met een zeer fijne balans in aromaÂ’s en smaken. Aangename kennismaking met deze Duitse brouwerij.
Bottle at home, brown, small head. Aroma is smokey, smoked ham, malt, some caramel. Taste is the same, nice one.
33cl fles. Helder robijnrood kleur, grofe witte schuimkraag. Aroma van rook en karamel. Smaak is zoet, droog rook, karamel en alcoholisch. Vol lichaam, veel koolzuur.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Smoked sheep cheese (oscypek), bread, melanoidin, herbs in nose. Pours dark amber with white head. Taste is sweet with bread, melanoidin, smokiness, caramel. Low bitter finish, full body, average carbonation. Overall very good.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2010 (Day 2), EarlÂ’s Court, London Aug 2010 - As "Beck Brau Affumicator " - Orangey Amber in colour. Cloudy. Very smokey aroma. Strong robust smoked taste; smoked wood campfire; smoked ham & frankfurters. Malty; roasty malts, caramel. Warming alcohol very evident. Smooth. Very dry smokey finish; smoke lingers forever. Interesting. Terrific Smoke Beer! (2010-08)
UPDATED: JAN 17, 2017 My favourite beer of all time, never had something similar. Hogh smokyness with a long persistance, caramel, high body.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a murky medium brown with a bubbly white head. The aroma is spicy smoky bacon. The flavour is roasty liqourice malt with a bacon spicy sweet malt liqourice palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Aroma is thick smoked malt, smoked ham, caramel malt, smoked bacon, hint of dried fruit with a touch of alcohol. Flavour is medium sweet and above moderate bitter, slightly boozy. Body is above medium. Very rich and smooth mega-smoked Doppelbock, pretty great.

Smoked meats, very sweet malts, caramel, molasses, honey smoked ham. Hazy, dark amber, medium, creamy, off-white head. Medium sweet. Heavy sweet, dark grain malts, molasses, malts turn bittersweet, light smoked meats again, rich texture, soft carbonation, full bodied, bittersweet and smoked finish. Beautiful Smoked, agreed with the hype, this is a very nice and complex example, intense yet subtle. Bottle from Mother KellyÂ’s Bottle Shop E9, Hackney.
Birra affumicata scura, malto, speck, scamorza, molto corpo, zero schiuma, persistente in bocca, capolavoro del genere

Draft at Borefts, thanks all for sharing. Especially thanks to the bastrd who made me go through this. Smoked all the way, honestly how bad can it get? Totally not my style so will stay mild on scoring.

CÂ’est franchement bizarre. JÂ’ai vraiment lÂ’impression dÂ’avoir de la sauce barbecue dans la bouche.
On est sur la rondeur, le caramel de la doppelbock, un cÃ´tÃ© sauce soja/sirop dÂ’Ã©rable. Le cÃ´tÃ© fumÃ© sur le cÃ´tÃ© sucrÃ© donne le goÃ»t "barbecue".
Ca se calme avec lÂ’aÃ©ration mais Ã§a reste particulier.
Bottle at home, 8th December 16. Pours a copper colour, some head. Aroma is smoke, sweet. Mouth feel is full and rich. Taste is smoke, sweet malts, complex and enjoyable.

On tap at Chinaski Levapies, Madrid on 3-Dec-2016, and served in a shaker. Hazy orange amber colour with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of smoked sausage. Fully body with soft/medium carbonation. Taste is heavily smoked malt and slightly sweet - maple syrup and bacon. I can seethe attraction, and rated highly for style (but not to my taste).

Bottle. Pours an unclear dark, caramel colored beer with a very small, quickly dispappearing off white head on top. Aroma of some smokey notes, roasted malts, caramel and some wood. Flavor is very sweet, smokey sensations all over, boozy notes, sweet in the aftertaste and soft and sticky in the mouthfeel. Has some alcoholic burn on the tongue after swallowing, only really light. Aftertaste is very nice, sweet and with smoke as well. Great stuff.

24/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1180) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todayÂ’s beers!
Clear reddish brown beer, creamy off-white to yellow head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: soft smoke, lots of banana, bit sweet. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet, caramel, lots of ripe banana, more smoky. Aftertaste: sweet, caramel, alcohol, bitter, smoky.

A beautiful orange amber color with a film of beige foam. Smokey mesquite and barbecue bacon chips aroma. Full bodied with a lush mouthfeel. The taste is smokey honeyed bacon with Graham malts. Superb.

Bottle. Not quite clear deep amber with a pale beige head that never disappears. Enveloping smoky toffee vanilla toast aroma. Some delicate floral notes somehow float above. Reduced creamy texture with low carbonation. Sweet but not hugely so, but with layers of toasted and caramelised flavours, smoke and mild spices. Clean. No real sign of alcohol. Bitterness is moderate but somehow floats through unobstructed, causing the smoky toffee to fade very slowly away.

Bottle from World Beer Market. Murky light brown pour and low head. Lovely smoked ham aroma, not too overpowering, toffee, rosted malt, not too complex. The taste is where it shines. Delicious smoked meats over rich malts, caramel, a touch of booze bringing in a slight dark fruit and sweetness. I heard the bottle lacked some carb and yeah itÂ’s a bit flat, but itÂ’s full and smooth, almost veering towards barleywine but with the bock malts and ever-present smoke. Fantastic balance.

Bottle at home. Clear amber pour, almost no head. Aroma of smoked malts, caramel, slightly spicy and a hint of licorice. Flavor is quite sweet, smokey and with a thick body. Very well balanced. Nice one.

330ml bottle. Cloudy, copper-ish brown colour with late awakening, average to huge, thick, creamy, mostly lasting, well lacing, sulphureous beige head. Woody, smoky and slightly peaty aroma with hints of leather, a cautious touch of shoe polish, liver and sticking-plaster. Taste is moderately sweet, smoky and caramel malty, peaty, hints of sticking-plaster, TCP, asphalt; full body, oily texture, gentle, adequate carbonation. Slightly overdone, not as balanced as Schlenkerla beers, slightly too far in the peat and TCP direction.

Tap - dark brown color with small head. low carbonation. body is medium to strong, sticky oily texture. Heavy notes of smoke and bacon, caramel, dried fruits, dark wood. very complex. a great one. alcohol perfectly hidden.
Tap at Salon piva. Orange color, thick white head. Aroma is smoked, malty, light caramel, candies. Taste is sweet, malty, caramely, smoked, decent hoppy

At BBF, clear intense deep Red color, mellow aroma of smoked meat with light charred wood and light maltiness behind, charred wood and caramel flavor with some chocolate and smoked meat in the back. Very nice and enjoyable sipping beer.

Bottle. Pours si cloudy amber to birownish with thick white head. Aroma of smoked malts, smoked cheese, touch of herbs. Light sweet, light bitter, smoke notes on tongue. Heavy body, oily texture, flat carbonation, smokey mouthfeel.
Jebus god damn. Super sticky, smokey treat. This would be a prime candidate for aging. Like a smokey Samiclaus. Rich, decadent, Ganstaller can brew.
Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Dark caramel pour with a fine-grained tan head. Notes of smoke, caramel, bacon, dried fruit. Medium body and carbonation and a sweet and smokey finish.

On tap at Borefts, shared.
Thin creamy off white head. Clear light burgundy pour. Smokey aroma and aftertaste. Nicely balanced. Well done.

33cl bottle at home. Pale dark reddish amber with a medium off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Smoky sweetness with well balanced bitterness. Roasted malts, caramel, brown sugar, smoke and spices. Very good rauchbier!

Multiple full draught [emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016 - Day 1 and Day 2. Bref: Imperial Smoked Doppelbock on 95% Rauchmalz never tasted so smooth... Dry toffee sits comfortably perched under a smoked ham glazing close to maple syrup served on rich caramel pancakes. A bit of warmth, but no burn or fusel - yes this is a lager. Drier, cleaner/"preciser" and hoppier than Schlenkerla Eiche and Urbock.

Draught @ BoreftsÂ’16: Served in a taster:
Almost clear brownish amber body, creamy head.
Nose of smokey, fruity, leather...
Flavours of fruity, bitter, smokey, toast, leather...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Good stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 2. Clear amber brown with a cream head. Aroma of massive smoke, malt, caramel and toffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [24-09-2016]
van de tap op borefts 2016 amber met een creme kraag. Geur en smaak mooi vol met rozenbottel, een zagerij en eikenrook. mooie volle body. Heerlijk rookbier!

Draft @ Borefts 2016. Shared with RB Belgian crew.
Brune foncÃ©e, crÃ©meux beige.
ArÃ´me offre un bouquet bien fumÃ© avec un petit relent de bbq, maltÃ© divin offrant de belles effluves de Bamberg malt, pointe de houblonnÃ© lÃ©ger en retrait.
Palais est maltÃ© avec un fumÃ© trÃ¨s dominant et chargÃ© en note de de porc grillÃ©, caramel est profond avec un accompagnement finemetn fruitÃ© sec/noir.
Alcool est bien prÃ©sent et renforce cette sensation de fumÃ©. Pas grand chose dÂ’autres Ã  dire, cÂ’est du solide.
Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016, Day 1. Nice red color, medium sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, smoke, moderately sweetish. Nice rauchbeer.
On tap at Borefts 2016. Clear, dark amber. Smoky, ashy aroma. Almost like drinking smoked brisket. Mellow. Silky.

Dark brown. Super creamy beautiful smoked lager combined with thick spicy German doppelweizen style bock... I adored it, one of the very few beers I had multiple of at Borefts, and and my closer beer. Concentrated taste, enough sweetness against the spice and strong burned wood style smoke. Absolutely delicious! (On tap at Borefts 2016)

Tap at Borefts. Clear dark amber with beige head. Lots of smoked ham, ash, burning wood, peach, lots of caramel, some toffee, smoked fruits. Over medium sweet and light bitter. Over medium bodied with slick sugary feel. I just donÂ’t like smoked beers...

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 2. Clear dark chestnut brown with offwhite head. Sweet roasted and smoked malts. Caramel, pine resin, sweet bitter tea, chestnut. Big sweet and mild bitter. Over medium body, low carbonation. Fresh mocca icecream feel. Rich bittersweet smoked finish.
sample at BBF, poured murky amber to light brown, nose of smoked malts, tobacco, prunes, light raisins, cacao, smoked bacon. dry smoked aftertaste.
. Dark brown.. Thin tan lacing... Soft smoke Roast malts nose... Herbal soft toffee malts.. Light sweet toffee fruit
Wow. Intense cream appearance that settles into a fairly large head. Smells like salami. Taste is smoke, bark, and malt.
Bruin oranje bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt gerookt, spek, mout. Smaakt gerookt, spek, mout.

Bottle 0.33l from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 14.07.2016. Taste with Zlotta. Pour it hazy dark amber color with small white head. Aroma nice caramel malt, pleasant smoke note. Taste sweet caramel, some sweet fruity feel, smoked ham, vanilla, nice balanced, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish. Perfect!
Brown with white head. HUGE bacon, smoke, bbq and caramel. Sweet, meaty, noble hops, floral and lingering smokey finish. Great!!! Really impressive!

0,33l bottle at home. BB 31.05.2018. brown / light redish clear color, medium small off-white / yellowish head. smells smoked, light peat, earthy, spices, bacon, some caramel, sausages, light berry notes, raisins. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather sweet, caramel, some dried fruits, raisins, honey, only rather light smoke, bit earthy, glaced bacon, peppery, spices, hints of alcohol, light herbs. finishes medium sweet with some bacon and earthy notes. overall good one, expected a bit more, quite heavy sweet taste, almost no smoke notes on the taste. I guess I prefer my Rauchbiers more sessionable. Might be an interesting experiment to age this one for a while in the cellar though.

Reddish brown beer, opaque, quite dark, weak head.
Smell is bbq, meat, smoke and bitterness. Salty, subtle caramel sweetness, touch of apple.
Taste is fruity sweetness, hint of sourness and strong ashy bitterness. Apples again and a pungent sour alcoholic astringency - quite unpleasant.

21.08.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice light amber fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and mineraly, caramel malts, minerals, smoked bacon, nuts, grass, weeds, hay, "knekk", alcohol. Taste is slightly concentrated and dry mineraly, weeds, caramel malts, minerals, alcohol, smoke, grass, "knekk", hops. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel. Nice enough.

330 ml bottle. BB 31/05/16. Thanks Timo A. for this one!
Clear amber color with no head. 
Smoked ham, some sourness and lard in a deep aroma. Butcher comes to my mind. Sweet caramel malt, smoked ham and smoked wood in the flavor.

pours light reddish brown, clear, with beige foamy tan lasting head. Visually low to medium carbnoation. Aroma: intense, rich smoked aroma, which takes on smoked ham, bacon, leather, with hint of honey, toffee, caramel in the background. Flavor: caramel, toffee, flover honey, hint of acacia, on second half steps forward note of smoked, which takes on dicrete smoked bacon, supported with spicy, herbal/floral hop bitterness. Finish is dry, slightly sticky. Body is medium to high, texture is very smooth, syrupy, carbonation is medium. Alcohol warmt is noticeable only in aftertaste. Big surprise.

Bottle, 0.33l, courtesy of Bongtribe. Pours hazy amber orange color with thick creamy tan-like head and good lacing. Aroma of smoke, leather, ham, caramel and honey. Taste starts with sweet caramel and toasted malt, follows smoky, umami and nutty, mouthfeel is warming with well hidden ABV, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, syrupy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Just excellent...

Bottle at CafÃ© Abseits. Amber-red color with beige head. Aroma is lightly smoked, ham, umami. Taste is more umami and ham, smoked souchong tea, quite chewy, rather dry, very oily mouthfeel. Natural carbonation. Good stuff, incredible that this beer is this strong.

The road was long and difficult. Not only to arrive to CafÃ© Abseits, but to discover the wonders of the Bamberg rauchbier. For some a trap, smoke and daggers. The dopplebock thug punching your lights out, colluding with the smoke master. But in a sunny Biergarten on a Saturday we found common ground. We became friends, no, allies. The madman who heads Ganstaller BrÃ¤u brought his a game. I was conquered.

Leicht trÃ¼bes dunkel orange goldenes Bier mit mittelgroÃŸen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sÃ¼ÃŸ malzig, sehr rauchig, holzig, rote FrÃ¼chte, Schinken. Geschmack sÃ¼ÃŸ malzig, Schinken, angenehm rauchig. Toll!
Bottle. Hazy amber with a medium sized beige head. Lots of meaty smoke. Wood, minerals, chalk, warming alcohol. Salty, sweet, fine bitterness. Heavy, but tasty and well balanced.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of smoked sausage, caramel, bonfire, matches, light citrus. Taste is huge smoke and sidage. Bonfire. Not my thing.

0.33 l bottle shared with markoijelena, best before May 2018. Slightly hazy, reddish amber with an off-white head. Sweetish, malty and very smoky aroma of caramel, some honey, lots of smoked salmon and campfire. Quite sweet, malty and quite smoky taste of caramel, honey, some nuts, a touch of chocolate, lots of smoked salmon and campfire, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, very smoky finish. Medium to full body, almost oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Love this style, and this is a great example!

33 cl bottle. BBE 31.05.2018.
Pours dark mahogany color with a small head. Very smoky-leathery aroma, caramel, lots of malts and subtle alcohol. Very malty flavor, thick and slick palate, some bitterness and wooden dryness, smoky tones and subtle caramel sweetness, slight alcohol burn at the end. Very nice smoky Doppelbock.
4425

330 ml. bottle. BBF 31.05.18. Lightly hazy deep amber, creamy small off-white head. Nose is super intense thick oily smoke, smoked tea caramel, pine syrup, honey goop, wood smoked, smoked tea, intense oil & syrup, this more than thick oil. Taste is just pure Lapsang & Tarry Souchong tea, pure concentrated oil, super oily caramel, esoteric oil, crazily thick honey, white grape jelly, caramel, biscuit & cookie oil, smoked oily bark, oil sweetness. Thick crazily oily Lapsang & Tarry Souchong tea caramel body. Lots of reviews seem to be comparing this one with Schlenkerla MÃ¤rzen but for me this is totally different, Schlenkerla is sweet malts, oily smoke, caramel etc. this one is pure intensified insanely oily smoked Chinese oil, there is caramel sweetness but it carries almost no malt character, all pure oil with a dash of sugar. There is so much to this, this is almost hard to drink, you have to fight with this beer, decadent & extreme to the limit this is an admirable treat.
Bottle. Copper red color. Aroma of smokey ham, malt and german rauch. Nice taste of rich german rauchmalz, bacon, malt and some caramel. This is nice.

Bottle thanks to Andreas. Slightly hazy copper beer with a nice lasting off-white head. Smoked aroma, malty, caramel, tar notes, some fruits, nuts, some biscuits. Smoked malt flavor, caramel, sweet fruits, hazelnuts, biscuit notes, tar, some dark bread. Very nice with alcohol well hidden.

Frankenfest 2016, Rome. Gorgeous deep, red tinged brown. Very creamy off-white foam. Astounding complex smoke. Lots of copper sweetness. Rich, sharp, a little caramel. Lovely sweet rich smoke. Sweeter caramel. Smoked salmon fattiness. Lovely!

At the Franken fest 2016 in Rome-Italy, on tap. Pours a completely cloudy dark copper color, infinite ivory head. Nose: provola cheese, smoked salmon, more salmon, dry fish. Mouth: superb soft carbonation, smoked fish, floral sweet finish. Meant for solid food. Top beer!

I am normally not a fan of smoked beers. But this is the first I really liked.
Dark amber color with a light beige head. Smoked bacon in the nose :-)
Off course lots of smoke in the flavor, but not that dominant. A lot of other flavors comes through also. Strangly enough the first I think of is smoked ham :-) Well masked alcohol.[On tap at GBBH 2010 - a friend and brewer at Grebbestad Brewery recomended this one]
Un altro capolavoro del maestro ! Inutile commentare le sue birre ! Sono tutte perfette

Draught @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa, Rome. Pours hazy dark amber with a offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, loads of smoke, smoked bacon/ham, some sweetness aswell. Flavor is rich malts, smoke, bacon, smoked ham, honey, caramel, some booze. Full body, soft carbonation, lasting sweet smoked finish. 080414

17/03/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fÃ  (tap). Ambrata carica, intensa, limpida, riflessi miele di castagno, schiuma bianca sporca media e persistente. Al naso sentori di caramello, dolciastra, etilica, potente affumicato, bacon, fumo, sontuosa, infinita, da sniffare per ore! In bocca Ã¨ davvero "tanta roba", attacco maltato, gran corpo, quindi una nota affumicata potente, di quelle che lasciano il segno. Una birra sontuosa, quasi arrogante nella sua potenza, evocativa come poche altre. Perfetta per accompagnare un bello stinco di maiale con patate.

On tap at Akkurat. Pours dark reddish with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, red berries and smokey meat.Taste is sweet malt and smoke, light bitter and smooth creamy body, soft carbonation.
Rated 2011: The head is robust, the body brown-orange and cloudy. It smells intensive smoky, a bit sweet-alcoholic. The taste is viscous, intensive smoky, a bit bitter. Great! 11/12/12/12/-/12

Draught at Ã˜lbaren, Copenhagen. Dark amber color. Strong smoky bacon and leather aroma. Sweet smoky flavor with bacon, toffee, bread, raisins, burnt leather and alcohol warmth. Very malty and very smoky.

Tap at Olbaren, Copenhagen, thanks to Johan. I had too many glasses of this, and it was after a long, long way of drinking - but it was just damn good. ItÂ’s a big, sweet and smokey beer. Lots of caramel, some smokey ham, straight smoke. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Nice stuff. Mild warming finish, big and sweet, lots of smokey ham, light honey. Yeah, just a damn solid smoked beer on every level.

On tap at Ã˜lbarten.
Strong bacon aroma and flavour, the porkiness is too overpowering here. Oak, floor polish.

I prefer this one over the schlenkerla. Smells like a smokehouse. Various malty flavors under the smokiness, which I think is primarily what makes this better than the aecht for me, as that one is just full-on smoke, and after a few sips of schenkerla all I can imagine is bacon grease. Full body; this completely dominated my palate for the rest of the night, everything after this tasted flat.

7th August 2009GBBF. Cask. Slight haze on this dark amber beer. Thick tan head. Soft palate. Creamy sweet malt with smooth smoky fish. Smooth and soft. Biscuit sweet malt. A little bubblegum sweetness. Very creamy smooth sumptuous beer. Very nice indeed.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Lovely amber-brow with a big head. Enormous smoky nose, bacon, salmon, bonito flakes. HugeÂ—with not much else coming through, but great. Smoked bacon flavor, with caramel and a bit of chocolate, sweet bready malts and some nice hop bitterness. Huge flavor all around but well balanced still. Big, full, smooth mouth. Amazing. The alcohol is so well hidden.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2016 oh fuck.  fatty meaty smoked ham nose instantly a 10, instantly one of the best smoked beers, best beers, best things iÂ’ve smelled in my life.   chewy, hearty, meaty ffuuuuuuuuu smokey sweet malt up front, tangy peppery late, 30 minute lingering finish.   decadent, rich, toasty malt perfect balance of sweetness, toast, smoke and bitterness. fruit pith and rind, light herbal notes, some black pepper, caramel / toffee richness throughout.  this is a malt showcase.  hearty, salty honey glazed ham skin cracklins, incredibly chewy and smooth and full. this is what i want Schlenkerla to be to me again, but itÂ’s not.  I had oak barrel Urbock the night before and found it the poorest batch IÂ’ve ever had, which made me uneasy at the time, because either my tastes have changed or the brew had. regardless, this was a magical moment and I donÂ’t think any  Schlenkerla has matched, if you can believe that.  I couldnÂ’t either.  and IÂ’m doing Bavaria for kellerbier and pilsner and not in the mood for rauchbier or anything high gravity on this day, but Andreas insists I try his rauchdoppelbock and brings me a glass from the back and my mind fucking melted.

Draught in Strassgiech.

Head is lasting.
Body is medium to dark brown.

Aroma is moderately to heavily malty (roasted grain, toasted nuts, caramel, cookie), with notes of hickory smoked bacon, xmas tree, fireplace, tar, fruitcake, dried mango, orange zest, plum, and manure.

Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is moderately sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, velvety/syrupy texture, lively/soft carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

The aroma is just completely off the hook.  You thought Schlenkerla was complex, well...this is on entirely different level.  Mind you, this is definitely a slow sipper and quite sweet, but itÂ’s not at all a fatiguing sugar-and-alcohol bomb.  Just as light pale lagers are very difficult to make well, so too are big beers like this, yet Andreas does both expertly.  A truly amazing beer.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2012 2012-04-27, draught at Ã˜lbaren, Copenhagen, 9.6% ABV, 7-5-8-4-15=39First pour of the keg; hazy red-amber color, with a generous, nice creamy head. The aroma is not fully appealing, because not only it has the (appreciated) smoke, but also a strange rancid sourness. Strong body, sweet malt and caramel flavor, that would make a good Doppelbock; on top of that, there is the expected strong smoke flavor, sweetness, light malt sourness; it has a respectable bitterness level, and some alcohol warmth. Maybe just too sweet for this combination of smoke and rancidity.Good, but excessive, unelegant.2011-12-09, cask at Ã˜lbaren, Copenhagen, 10% ABV, 8-5-8-4-17=42Hazy mahogany color, with huge compact head. The aroma is quite cheesy, almost English, a bit smokey. The body is structured, the mouthfeel is smooth; it has a fat flavor of malt and caramel, quite sweet; the smoke is present but not as strong as the Schlenkerla, or at least itÂ’s hidden by other factors; the alcohol can be perceived; also traces of yeast; the bitterness is quite strong, with some dark caramel too in the final.Very good, but side to side with the Schlenkerla Urbock, this one is rough; big but less elegant. It gets more appreciation with the second glass, and slow drinking.2010-06-04, RBESG 2010, draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti A FÃ , Rome, 9.8% ABV, 7-5-8-4-14=38Hazy red-amber color; generous head. Very nice dry smoke aroma. Strong body, caramel flavor, with a good share of residual sugars; smoke, strong and sweet; I find that the bitterness is just too high and the alcohol perception too. Good beer, but somehow too much.

Nice, this was brewed for the bar I had it at: Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa.  On draft.  Hazy golden copper with a large white head.  Huge smoky ham aroma.  A bit of sweet malt hides behind the ham sandwich.  The flavor has a sweet malt base and great smoky flavor with ham, speck, prosciutto, all those tasty smoked deli meats.  Medium body and a smooth texture.  Great stuff.  A smoked beer I would revisit if I wasnÂ’t a shameless ticker.

on tap @ Ma che sete venuti a fa (Roma). I was a bit curious about this beer for a friend of mine told me I should try it (cause IÂ’m a huge rauchbier lover). I hoped not to be disappointed as I was by Schwan Rauch and helas! Affumicator rocks! Smells like bacon and the taste is not aggressive (even though I like when the smoked taste hits yo ulike a punch on your face)

SÃ¼ÃŸlich hopfiger Antrunk mit deutlichem Rauchcharackter, der aber noch nicht dem sÃ¼ÃŸen Hopfen gleichsteht und erst mit der Zeit immer weiter hervorkommt. Dabei spielt der Hopfen sowie die mitgebrachte Bitterkeit eine groÃŸe Rolle, sÃ¼ÃŸlich, perfekt abgestimmt. Zum Ende sehr viel rauchiger, trotz des sehr starken Aromas wirkt das Bier nie Ã¼bertrieben, da eine deutliche SÃ¼ÃŸe fÃ¼r Ausgleich sorgt. Im spÃ¤ten Nachgeschmack rÃ¶stig. /14/12/14//14

Getestet Festival der Bierkulturen 15.05.2010 
Im Geruch zurÃ¼ckhaltend schinkenrauchig. ZunÃ¤chst sÃ¼ÃŸlicher Antrunk. Sehr bald wird das Bier stark rauchig, schinkig und malzbetont. SÃ¼ÃŸ-rauchig und angenehm alkoholisch ausklingend. Fast perfekt gelungenes Rauchbier. Sehr gut.

Tap at Ma Che Siete.. A dark brownish orange with a large, creamy offwhite head. Loads of smoke obviously. Not the campfire sort, more the smoked meat sort. There is also a sweetness here, so the whole thing reminds me of honey glazed smoked ham. Slightly salty, and I almost want to say iodine, but itÂ’s not quite it. Quite a bit of honey/caramel sweetness on the tongue, with a salty, smokey finish.  Some alcohol sweetness and a slight burn in the finish as well. Feels like IÂ’m having desert first, then a savoury alcoholized meal. Semidry finish. I certainly enjoyed it.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a FÃ  in Rome. The pour is a clear, tea amber with a diminishing, thick head. Aroma is huge bacon, smoke, lemon, sorbet, meat, flowers, honey, insane amount of glazed barbecue. Taste is smoked Gouda cheese 100%, citrus rind bitter, fatty cheese. Palate is soapy, chemical, bacon, grease, soapy bitter. Really nice stuff!

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a FÃ , Rome. Pours clear amber with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of bonfire and smoked bacon. Taste is dark malty, with the smoked sensation kicking in at the end, lingering all the way, a smoked classic.

Tiny cask @ Ã˜lbutikken. Thanks! Pours a clear dark amber with a diminishing off-white head. Smells of smoked malts. Quite bitter with aromas of smoked malts and alcohol. Also some residual sugars. Hints of fruits and wood. Medium to full bodied. Soft carbonation. Bitter and smoked finish.

From a wooden cask at Ã˜lbutikken. Aroma has a massive smoke component, woody smoke, like a campfire, aroma reminds me of sitting on benches made of piled, tarred wood. Malts are crispy and caramelly and the yeast component gives a nice sweet touch. The smoke in the taste is actually a bit mellow, very balanced, a bit of chili bite, and caramel malts are very crispy. Not very complex, but just very well crafted.

On Tap at NWAF, Manchester 21.01.11   Pours hazy amber, touch of orange, white head. This is very smokey full on Bratwurst assault in the mouth but there is a good bitterness and some citrus. There is a touch of fuzzy bitterness, its wonderful, taste is quite pokey with with the alcohol showing a little, but I really, really liked this, one of my favourites of the day.  A8 A3 T8 P4 Ov17  4.0
Cask at NWAF, 2011. Cloudy orange pour with a beige head. Smoky-fruit nose. Spicy. A little peach aroma. Flavours of smoke, fruit and spices. Very well balanced. Smoke fuelled, dry finish. Lovely!

I found it a very complex Beer. I think it is a very good product, but if you are not aware of what a smoked beer is, this could be too much heavy on the stomach. I usually drink it in small size. The smell is very impressive. It seems to be in front of a ham and cheese dish. Dense colour and full-bodied, itÂ’s just very good but itÂ’s not my favourite one.

On tap at  Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa, Rome. Hazed amber with white head. This has the flavour of wet bonfire with smokey peat and smoked pork sausage and crackling. Good flavours and full on the palate, great stuff.

Draft. Pours a hazy and amber beer with a white head. The aroma is malt, smoke and roasted. The flavor is malt, roasted, caramel, smoke and some notes of dried fruit. The palate is smoked. Overall a good smoked beer.
Pours copper with a white head. Aroma is caramel, smoke and salami. Flavour is caramel, smoke and fruity notes.

Small white head. Hazy yellow body. Light clean smoky charcoal aroma with mealy notes. Dry-sweet-bitter earthy smoky grassy taste with floral notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dry grassy smoky resiny aftertaste with floral fruity notes. Delicately smoked and drinkable. (0.2l draft at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.)
Draught. Low fluffy lasting off-white head. Hazy amber body. Smoke bacon roasted malt aroma. Bacon smoke roasted malt caramel flavor. Relatively mild. Low carbonation. Short sweet aftertaste.

(draught) pours a very murky amber colour with a dense off-white head. surprisingly subtle aroma of honey-smoked ham and grass, perhaps even some light notes of peat. flavour is smoked ham and barnyard, light caramel, sweet spices and a hint of alcohol, overall a little too much on the sweet side though. medium to heavy-bodied, quite viscous, with smooth carbonation.

On draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa. Pours a very dense dark amber with fine bubble ran head. 9.8 percent. bog smokey aroma. Full body. Solid malty flavor with slightly sweet flavor balance. Smoke flabor throughout but evenly matched to big malt and big alcohol character. Malty sweet finish. OK/

(draught at Festival der Bierkulturen, KÃ¶ln) Hazy, dark orange to amber colour with a short off-white foamy layer. Pronounced smoke-malty aroma with notes of bacon and wood, accompanied by subtle fruity notes, caramel and shades of hops. Moderately sweet flavour with a balanced hoppy bitterness, full bodied with a soft carbonation. Hearty malt-character with a distinctively smokey touch; increasingly dry and hop bitter towards the finish, which has also minor traces of alcohol. Well-rounded smoked Bock. 16.V.10
Exciting, but very strong for me. Strange, never drank something like that.
Hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma had smoke, ham and toasted malt. Smoked flavor with roasted malt, ham and caramel. Finished smoked.

Draft. An unclear amber beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma has strong notes of smoke as well as medium notes of salami. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of smoke as well as medium notes of salami, malt, and caramel, leading to a slightly spicy finish.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 19 June 2010) Dark amber colour with brief, off-white head. Malty, smoky nose with notes of dried fruit, smoked malt and hints of smoked ham. Malty, smoky taste with dried fruit, smoked ham or sausages, dried apricots and a spicy finish with a touch of warming alcohol. Full body, fairly sweet. Lovely smoke character. Very nice beer.
a rather dense smoke on the nose (not as Â’baconÂ’edÂ’ as skibsÃ¸l or burnout) the taste is somewhat mellowed, which lets the nose work Â’throughÂ’ the taste. in the end some bitter hops

Very strong smoke aroma. Somewhat in the tastee also. Balanced, full. Nice for a smoked, still not my style.

Purchaseed tap at mikkeller bar.
Draught. Clear amber brown colour. Lovely smokey peat heavy aroma. Good mouthfeel. Very good flavour of smoke, peat, bacon, caramel and some sweetness. Great smoked brew!

From tap at Ma Cha. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is smoked and meaty. Dark caramelish, fruity, roasted malt and slight metallic with a distinct meaty base. Bitter, roasted, malty and smoked into a dry finish.

On tap. RBESG Rome 2010. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Fat Bamberg smoke in the nose. Only a medium body yet with a distinct base of caramel and roasted malts and again a shitload of fat and greasy smoke accents. Not overly bitter finish. 040610
Tap at Mikkler bar.Hazy amber colour with medium white head.Aroma of caramel,leater and fruits.Flavor of smoked ham and dried fuits nice well balanced with fresh hoppy finish.

Sample at Mikkeller Bar.
Amber with an off-white head. Aroma heavy smoky. Flavor light sweet of caramel, heavy smoky, to extreme. Despite the strength no sense of the alcohol at all. I like smoke beers, but itÂ’s out of balance.

On tap at Ma Che Siete. Hazy amber pour with a medium off white head. Loads of caramel and smoke in the aroma. Light fruity notes. No scense of the alcohol at all. The flavour is caramel, fruit and lots of smoke. Extremely balanced and drinkable.

Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Rome Pours unclear orange with a small creamy white head. Heavy peat, bacon, camp fire and even some fresh hops beneath. Some caramel. Dry hoppy end with a lot of peat. Smooth and stikcy palate.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a FÃ , Roma. Holy smoke this is huge! Cheers Manuele for tapping a fresh keg too. Amazing aroma and it would have to be the smokiest of the Rauchbiers. All the good stuff of fatty smoked ham, cheese, woody and caramel glaze. The flavour is robustly smoked yet manages to hold a soft smoothness - I guess from the caramel character. Full mouthfeel but excellent balance. The higher ABV does creep in but by no way did it take away from the beer. Glorious drop.
Draught at Moeder Lambik, Brussels. Clear dark red/amber - offwhite head. Nice smokey. Fruity. Caramel. Sweetness. Nutty. Wood smokey.

In short: A tasty, very smoky, a bit boozy beer with a very nice refreshing fruity character
How: Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a FÃ , Rome Italy
The look:  Partly Cloudy golden orange body topped by medium white head
In long:  Nose is very smoky, maybe the most smoky nose I had next to a Schlenkerla.  Here the smoke character is somewhere between wood smoke and smoked ham.  Taste is scarily smooth for a near 10% brew.  A lot of toasted cereals, flavor of bread crust. a lot of smoke and a lot of refreshing tropical fruits.  Alcohol is a bit apparent and that is the only thing I find wrong with this beer.  The blend of extreme smokiness and refreshing fruit character is just unreal. Schlenkerla has competition.  It is unfortunate that it is a bit too boozy for its own good.  Make it 7% and this is a masterpiece.  Boozed-up, totally smoked, can only be found in a pub.  Reminds me of myself some years ago.

From a 5L keg, most of which spewed in great agitation from my third floor balcony down to the garden and sidewalk below. Much also ended up on the balcony itself, and my dog drank more of it than we did. Today the beagle is hungover and looking at me as if to say, "hey, stop shouting." Nevertheless there were a few pints left for us. Cheers to DerDoppelbock! Very smoky nose reminiscent of maple-glazed ham. Sweetish caramel taste with mild, clean bitterness and long, deep, smoky backdrop and lingering aftertaste. Amazingly drinkable considering its strength and level f smokitude. Brusquely asks for some teriyaki beef jerky. Wonderful stuff, really. But donÂ’t take my word for it. Ask the beagle.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. 
Hazy amber colour with solid head. Fruity aroma with a backbone of smoke. Fatty mouthfeel, with big fruitiness and smoke, the latter dominates of course. Incredibly malty without being too sweet. There is almond paste, and lots of esters but it never gets too much. The beer is very balanced with a smooth, almost oily body, and finishes without any alcohol bitterness.
Dal colore ambra, buona lÂ’olfattiva, sensazioni affumicate, non troppo invadenti. Si sentono i luppoli. In bocca torna lÂ’affumicato, buono il corpo.

From barrel at the Great British Beer Festival, August 2009. Copper colour. Very smoky aroma. More on the palate. Maybe a little plastic. Still an excellent smoked, albeit an Â“in your faceÂ” one. Alcohol not too dominant.

Draught.

Pours brown orange with a creamy  white head.

Smoke, sausage, malt and toffe. Barley wine like sweetness and mouthfeel, which was the only hint of the alcohol.

Smooth, comlex but balanced.

On tap at Akkurat.

Dark amber. The foam was large, thick and white.

The aroma was smoky with some fruitiness. The taste was absolutely wonderful, without a doubt the best tasting Smoked beer I have drank. Smoked bacon, salt, spices and a nice sweetness. Aftertaste was dry with some bitterness. Nicely balanced and very easy to drink despite 9,6%. Weltklasse!

Draught @ Akkurat. Ap: Dark orange color. Hazy, Creamy white head. Ar: Smoked and the usual hefeweizen tigerbalsam thing. Fla: Smoked sausage at first, then a lighter almost hefeweizen like taste of banana and some spices. Finishes with a small bitterness with som licorice. Small vinous taste reminds the drinker of the 9,6% abv. Pal, Ov: Oily, smooth texture. Big bodied. Clean. A beer with contrasts that still is very well balanced. Very good!

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Hazy dull amber with a rich sticky off-white head. Rich aroma of smoke, bacon, tar and salty licorice. Full-bodied notes of tar, bacon, licorice, smoke and mild caramel. Solid yet rounded mouthfeel. Long smokey finish with notes of tar, bacon and salty licorice. Rock solid.
Deep amber with a lasting tan head. Bacon and campfire smoke aroma with bready malt and a hint of alcohol. Dry and malty, well balanced flavour with great smoke flavours, wood and campfire.
Tasted at the first, great, Borefts Beer Festival 2009 @ De Molen.  Amber colored brew. Aroma has got a very nice smoke aroma, caramel, some hops. Flavor is smoky, nice! Malty, some hops. Good brew.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2010 1. Cask Stillage at the GBBF, EarlÂ’s Court 05/08/2009
Smoked bacon aroma. Amber coloured strong in alcohol and malty with a big smoky bacon flavour. A little bitterness and dryness in the finish.
2. Cask Stillage at the GBBF, EarlÂ’s Court 04/08/2010
Big smoked aroma. Amber coloured a little rich on the palate and strong in alcohol with a smoked flavour. A hint of dryness and bitterness in a smoked finish.

Cask @ 1st BBF, De Molen.
Pours hazy orange amber with a nice, creamy, white head. Aroma has smoke, lots of caramel, sweet rye, light sugar and a hint of flowery hops. Light, medium carbonation, nice creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is smokey, slightly meaty, lots of sweet malts and a really good, flowery hoppy dry finish. Nice.
Cask @ BBF. Slight hazy golden color, medium head. Aroma of smoke, slight grain, malt, ashtray. Nice smoked taste, slight bitter, bit malty. Very nice smoked brew.

Tap @ 1ste Borefts. A little hazy orange colored beer, with a tick foamy light beige head. The aroma of smoked malts with notes of fruits. Th taste has also a lot of smoked malts with fruits and in the back some bitter and little alcohol. The aftertaste is somed with bitterness.

Draught at 1st Borefts Beer Festival at De Molen.
Clear orange coloured with a small off white head.
Smoked aroma of caramel and hops with notes of dried fruits.
Smoked flavour of caramel and hops with notes of dried fruits.
Smoked finish.
Too smoked for me.

On tap @ 1st BBF, de Molen. The aroma has smoked meat, some hay and caramel malts. Hazy, amber-yellow coloured beer with a white head. The taste is bitter, malty with a smokey dry background and finish. Medium bodied. This is a very good beer.
Cask at BBF. Amber body with foamy head. Nose of smook and some caramel. Flavours too. Sweet and hammy. Enjoyable with a dry finish.

Light hazy, orange/yellow colour, off-white head, good lace. Smoked, bitter, light sweet, bit alcoholic. Well hoped powerful smoked beer. Great stuff!

Cask gravity @ 1st BBF De Molen. What an excellent beer! Amber color. Smoked ham in the aroma. Full bodied. Loads of peaty malt, smoke and smoked sausage in the flavor. Slightly alcoholc. Long smoky aftertaste with a hint of licorice.

On draft at 1st Borefts Bier Festival, Bodegraven. Light coloured, fair head. Smoky nose, some caramel, oak. Very full-flavoured, smoke all the way, evolving and finishing into a very dry finish. Good stuff.

Tap (PINT Bockbierfestival 09): Pale amber, big - slowly collapsing - lacy white foam: burnt wood and sweet caramel in the nose; solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied; increasing dryness and hoppy bitterness in the lingering and warming finish. Very well balanced, tasty Bock...............

A Mes rate. Keg at GBBF.A lightish brown colour with no head. Yum yum, this is proper bonfire stuff. Burnt wood and smoked malt all round. Just a hint of alcohol but otherwise itÂ’s well hidden. Very clean, drinkable and tasty. An excellent rauch.

On tap at GBBF 2009.  Everyone had gone on about how good this was.  Smokey aroma.  Oddly a touch of TCP, but not in a bad way.  Tasty smokey TCP in flavour too.  Not too sweet for a bock, some biscuit in the malt even.  Finish has as smokey sting.  Yep, this is pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2013 [9/11/09] Draught at De Wildeman in Amsterdam. Deep red-amber with a thick beige head. Aroma of smokes sausages. Smoked flavor with lots of meat, caramel, malt, biscuits, lots of oak and a very bitter hoppy finish. Medium-bodied with a rounded-mouthfeel. A great smoked Bock.

Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Clearamber, no head. Smokey tarry bacon aroma. Mid-sweet with beautifully soft mouthfeel. Tarry salmiak - like Schlenkerla condensed. So seemless and soft - just beautiful!

Barrel @ GBBF2009.Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, smoke - bacon - rubber. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Burnt rubber and malt sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090805]

On tap at In de Wildeman, as Affumicator Dreidoppelrauchbock, to finish off the evening. What an amazing beer this is. Clear dark amber colour, creamy off white head. Aroma of thick smokiness and sweet malts. Flavour is greasy smoked eel, bready caramel malts, some salty smokiness, firm bitter salty finish. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, fullbodied. Yum!

Amber colour, small beige thick head. Aroma is bigtime smoked wood along with some bready malts and mild spicy notes as well. Flavour is the same along with mild sweetness from alcohol. Really pleasant and marvellous balance for being 9.6%.

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2009. "Affumikator"? 
Deep amber color, steady beige creamy head. Strong aroma of smoke. Very sweet malty, some alcohol and then loads of smokey ham. Lingering sweet smokeyness in the aftertaste. A bit too sweet, but otherwise interesting smoked beer.

From tap at GBBF 09. Hazy copper, huge yellowish head. Strong smoked malts aroma, hints of meat. Birch, cigarette smoke flavours. Hiding its strength well, well-crafted, but the style never makes me a believer. Sorry about that.

Hazy amber-brown.  Big smoke nose with lots of chewy malts.  Rich smoke - more campfire char than most rauchbiers.  Rich, long, chewy malt and smoke, with light caramel.  The smoke lingers on your tongue for hours.  Complex layers unveil themselves amidst an intimidating smoke character.  Damn!

Vat pour from Beck Brau. Hazy burnt sienna with thick stable beige head. Complex both aromas and flavors with layers of different kinds of smoke. Veers towards the spicy end of the spectrum. Has a lot of chorizo qualities with oily, spicy, intensely smoked flavors. The palate allows it all to be carried to different parts of the mouth. Absolutely smooth and does not feel strong at all. Feels very bright and satisfying. Has an extraordinary malt profile that imparts a well-integrated sweetness. Impressive.
